thread.title: Mille Lacs walleye season may end early, a blow to resorts
thread.title_full: Mille Lacs walleye season may end early, a blow to resorts

author: Mark Reilly
title: Mille Lacs walleye season may end early, a blow to resorts
text:
Mille Lacs walleye season may end early, a blow to resorts Jul 22, 2015, 7:09am CDT Share Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Bizspace Spotlight See All Bizspace Properties State limits on walleye catches on Mille Lacs Lake may be reached weeks ahead of schedule, a disappointment for resorts nearby that do big business during fishing season. Minnesota Public Radio reports that the lake is within 3,000 pounds of reaching its annual limit of about 28,000 pounds of fish â€” a big change from the end of June, when surveys suggested about 15,300 pounds remained. The catch limit is set by an agreement between the state and several Chippewa bands. Department of Natural Resources said the decline was due to big catches over the July 4 weekend and warmer-than-usual water, which drives up fish mortality when too-small fish are caught and then released. Officials are now considering ending the walleye season on the lake as soon as Aug. 3. Other types of fishing will still be allowed. But resorts in the area are worried; other fish types aren't as popular as walleye, and an early close to the season could hit businesses hard. The Star Tribune reports on that .
